description: Customize the powerful built-in Django administrative interface.

slides.title: The Killer Feature ğŸ¦„
slides.content:
# Instant Backend âš¡

Django reads your Models and automatically generates a professional, production-ready admin interface.

Great for content management, user testing, and admin tasks.

slides.title: Registering Models
slides.content:
# Making it Visible ğŸ‘€

In `admin.py`:

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
from django.contrib import admin
from .models import Person

admin.site.register(Person)
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Customizing the List
slides.content:
# ModelAdmin ğŸ› ï¸

Control how the list view looks.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
class PersonAdmin(admin.ModelAdmin):
    list_display = ('first_name', 'last_name', 'email')
    list_filter = ('is_staff', 'date_joined')
    search_fields = ('first_name', 'last_name')

admin.site.register(Person, PersonAdmin)
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Decorators
slides.content:
# Clean Registration âœ¨

You can use the `@admin.register` decorator.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
@admin.register(Person)
class PersonAdmin(admin.ModelAdmin):
    list_display = ('name', 'age')
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Inline Admin
slides.content:
# Nested Forms ğŸ“‘

Edit a Parent and its Children on one page (e.g., An Order and its Line Items).

`TabularInline` or `StackedInline`.

slides.title: Display Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which ModelAdmin attribute controls which columns are shown in the list of change view?

slides.title: Actions
slides.content:
# Batch Processing ğŸ“¦

Add custom actions to the dropdown menu (e.g., "Mark selected as published").

Functions that take `(modeladmin, request, queryset)`.

slides.title: Overriding Templates
slides.content:
# Full Control ğŸ¨

You can override the HTML templates for the admin site to change the branding, layout, or functionality.

Put templates in `templates/admin/`.

slides.title: Permissions
slides.content:
# Access Control ğŸ›¡ï¸

The admin respects user permissions.

- `has_add_permission`
- `has_change_permission`
- `has_delete_permission`

Override these methods in ModelAdmin to restrict access.

slides.title: Read-Only Fields
slides.content:
# Do Not Touch ğŸš«

Make specific fields uneditable.

`readonly_fields = ('created_at',)`

Useful for timestamps or audit logs.

slides.title: Ordering
slides.content:
# Sorting ğŸ“¶

Default sorting for the admin list.

`ordering = ('-created_at',)` (Newest first).

slides.title: Search Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: How do you enable a search box for your model in the admin interface?

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Admin Site ğŸ©

Your management dashboard.

- **Register:** `admin.site.register()`
- **Customize:** `list_display`, `list_filter`.
- **Inlines:** Edit related objects.
- **Actions:** Bulk updates.
